text: The New Zealand bellbird (Anthornis melanura), also known by its MƒÅori names korimako and makomako, is a genus of passerine bird. It is from New Zealand. It is green and the only species in its genus, Anthornis that is not extinct. == References == == Further reading == * == Other websites == * Holotype of Poor Knights bellbird Anthornis melanura oneho from the collection of the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa * Specimens of New Zealand bellbird Anthornis melanura melanura from the collection of the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa * Artist's depiction of Chatham Island bellbird Anthornis melanocephala Chatham Island Bellbird / Komako. by Paul Martinson. Artwork produced for the book Extinct Birds of New Zealand, by Alan Tennyson, Te Papa Press, Wellington, 2006 Category:Birds of New Zealand Category:Passeri
title: New Zealand bellbird
